application.name: Start Wayland
application.description: Makes necesary changes to start wayland correctly like the wayland symlinks. Please click only Once

application.name: Qt5 Custom Geometry Demo On wayland
application.description: The custom geometry example shows how to create a QQuickItem which uses the scene graph API to build a custom geometry for the scene graph. It does this by creating a BezierCurve item which is made part of the CustomGeometry module and makes use of this in a QML file.

application.name: Qt5 hellowindow demo On wayland
application.description: Qt demo Hello window shows 3 qt logos running in separate windows, for this it is required a windowing system such as wayland, if not present then it will show the 3 logos at the same time.

application.name: Qt5 opengl under qml demo On wayland
application.description: The OpenGL under QML example shows how an application can make use of the \l QQuickWindow::beforeRendering() signal to draw custom OpenGL content under a Qt Quick scene. This signal is emitted at the start of every frame, before the scene graph starts its rendering, thus any OpenGL draw calls that are made as a response to this signal, will stack under the Qt Quick items

application.name: Qt5 shader effects On wayland
application.description:
This example demonstrates a couple of visual effects that you can perform with shaders in QtQuick 2.0
ShaderEffects typically operate on other types, using a ShaderEffectSource \snippet quick/shadereffects/shadereffects.qml source In the above snippet, theItem is the id of a complex QML object in the file.

application.name: Qt5 simple material On wayland
application.description:
In this example, we will make use of the \l QSGSimpleMaterialShader class to fill a shape in the scene graph. This is a convenience class intended to avoid a lot of the boilerplate code required when creating materials with the \l QSGMaterial, \l QSGMaterialShader and \l QSGMaterialType classes directly.
A simple material consists of two parts, the material state and the material shader. The material shader has one instance per scene graph and contains the actual OpenGL shader program and information about which attributes and uniforms it uses. The material state is what we assign to each individual node, in this case to give them different colors.

application.name: Qt5 texture in sgnode On wayland
application.description: Qt demo showing a qml element as texture, brief Shows how to use FramebufferObjects with Qt Quick.

application.name: Disable Wayland
application.description: It creates the symlinks in order to use fb libraries instead of wayland. To Stop wayland stop and start the server. Please click only Once

application.name: Qt5 Custom Geometry Demo
application.description: The custom geometry example shows how to create a QQuickItem which uses the scene graph API to build a custom geometry for the scene graph. It does this by creating a BezierCurve item which is made part of the CustomGeometry module and makes use of this in a QML file.

application.name: Qt5 hellowindow demo
application.description: Qt demo Hello window shows 3 qt logos running in separate windows, for this it is required a windowing system such as wayland, if not present then it will show the 3 logos at the same time.

application.name: Qt5 opengl under qml demo
application.description: The OpenGL under QML example shows how an application can make use of the \l QQuickWindow::beforeRendering() signal to draw custom OpenGL content under a Qt Quick scene. This signal is emitted at the start of every frame, before the scene graph starts its rendering, thus any OpenGL draw calls that are made as a response to this signal, will stack under the Qt Quick items

application.description:
This example demonstrates a couple of visual effects that you can perform with shaders in QtQuick 2.0
ShaderEffects typically operate on other types, using a ShaderEffectSource \snippet quick/shadereffects/shadereffects.qml source In the above snippet, theItem is the id of a complex QML object in the file.

application.name: Qt5 simple material
application.description:
In this example, we will make use of the \l QSGSimpleMaterialShader class to fill a shape in the scene graph. This is a convenience class intended to avoid a lot of the boilerplate code required when creating materials with the \l QSGMaterial, \l QSGMaterialShader and \l QSGMaterialType classes directly.
A simple material consists of two parts, the material state and the material shader. The material state is what we assign to each individual node, in this case to give them different colors.

application.name: Qt5 texture in sgnode
application.description: Qt demo showing a qml element as texture, brief Shows how to use FramebufferObjects with Qt Quick.

application.name: MM07 demo Tai Ji girl
application.description: This OpenglES2 demo shows a 3D girl practicing Tai Ji. After the Tai Ji girl it shows a demo of a hoverjet 3D game. After that it will show a demonstration of ES2 shader capabilities, lightning and textures.

application.name: MM06 demo samurai
application.description: This openGL ES1 demo shows a 3D samurai with animations, after that comes a 3D game play simulation followed by a series of 3D texture and model examples.

application.name: OpenGL bbpinball demo
application.description: OpenGL pinball demo, this demo shows a pinball machine
